Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer properly weighed humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) factors against inadmissibility under Section 39 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Governing_Law: Section 25 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Section 39 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Decision_Outcome: Application for permanent residence refused due to financial inadmissibility
Legal_Rule: Section 25 requires weighing H&C factors against inadmissibility
Procedural_Issue: Officer failed to comply with Justice Hughes' Order
Outcome_on_Merits: Application refused initially, decision quashed on judicial review
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Officer ignored court order, failed to reassess H&C factors versus inadmissibility
Applicant_Challenge: Failure to properly weigh H&C factors against inadmissibility
Court_Result: Decision quashed, case remitted for redetermination by a different officer
Outcome: Permanent residence application refused initially; judicial review successful; case remanded
Remedy_Sought: Reassessment of H&C application in accordance with law and court order
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by remittal for redetermination
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remitted for reassessment
